intro: Aciclinium, commonly known as the golden mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange composite flowers. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, tubular flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Aciclinium thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
